IncidentREST Resource

Base class for all REST services that are limited by an org.

POST /orgs/{org_id}/incidents

Creates an incident.

Request Parameters
name type description default constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.    
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.    
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.    
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.    
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.    
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

    
org_id path The organization ID.   int
want_full_data query If false an incidentDTO is returned instead of the default fullIncidentDataDTO. The fullIncidentDataDTO contains everything about the incident. The incidentDTO will contain just a high level details. true boolean
want_tasks query If true the fullIncidentDataDTO tasks property gets filled in also. The default is false. Note that this parameter is ignored if want_full_data is false. false boolean
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json FullIncidentDataDTO (JSON) The incident data.
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json FullIncidentDataDTO (JSON) Echos back the saved incident data; either a fullIncidentDataDTO (if want_full_data is true) or an incientDTO if want_full_data is false.

PUT /orgs/{org_id}/incidents/{inc_id}

Saves an incident.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
inc_id path The incident ID of the incident being saved. int
org_id path The organization ID. int
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json FullIncidentDataDTO (JSON) The incident data to save.
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json FullIncidentDataDTO (JSON) Echos back the saved incident data.

PATCH /orgs/{org_id}/incidents

Patches multiple incidents.

Note that if a patch to an incident fails because of a conflicting edit made by another user, that entire incident (all patches for that incident) will fail. Other incidents may succeed.

For other types of failures (like if you reference an object that doesn't exist), the entire operation will fail. Also, business rule validation failures (such as "require on close" failures) will cause the entire operation to fail (for all incidents listed in the patch).

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
org_id path The organization ID. int
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json MultiPatchDTO (JSON) The incident patches to apply.
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json MultiPatchStatusDTO (JSON) A status object. Note that the failures field of the response will include details of the patch failure.

PATCH /orgs/{org_id}/incidents/{id}

Patches a single incident.

Note that the patch either completely succeeds or completely fails. There are no partial applications.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
id path The incident ID. int
org_id path The organization ID. int
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json PatchDTO (JSON) The patch to apply.
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json PatchStatusDTO (JSON) A status object.

PUT /orgs/{org_id}/incidents/patch

Patches multiple incidents using PUT HTTP verb for compatibility with HTTP clients.

Note that if a patch to an incident fails because of a conflicting edit made by another user, that entire incident (all patches for that incident) will fail. Other incidents may succeed.

For other types of failures (like if you reference an object that doesn't exist), the entire operation will fail. Also, business rule validation failures (such as "require on close" failures) will cause the entire operation to fail (for all incidents listed in the patch).

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
org_id path The organization ID. int
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json MultiPatchDTO (JSON) The incident patches to apply.
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json MultiPatchStatusDTO (JSON) A status object. Note that the failures field of the response will include details of the patch failure.

PUT /orgs/{org_id}/incidents/{id}/patch

Patches a single incident using PUT HTTP verb for compatibility with HTTP clients.

Note that the patch either completely succeeds or completely fails. There are no partial applications.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
id path The incident ID. int
org_id path The organization ID. int
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json PatchDTO (JSON) The patch to apply.
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json PatchStatusDTO (JSON) A status object.

GET /orgs/{org_id}/incidents

Gets a list of incidents.

Request Parameters
name type description default constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.    
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.    
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.    
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.    
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.    
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

    
org_id path The organization ID.   int
want_closed query true if closed incidents are to be returned (as well as open ones); false if only open incidents are to be returned. true boolean
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json array of IncidentDTO (JSON) The list of incidents.

POST /orgs/{org_id}/incidents/query

Query for incidents. The following is an example of a query that returns partial incident data returning only the custom incident field with the ID of 202: 

      /rest/orgs/201/incidents/query_paged?return_level=partial&field_handle=202
This request accepts both query parameters and an HTTP POST body.

Request Parameters
name type description default constraints multivalued
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.     no
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.     no
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.     no
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.     no
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.     no
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

     no
org_id path The organization ID.   int no
field_handle query List of custom fields returned with the incident data. The fields are specified using an objectHandle. If not specified, all custom fields are returned. -1   yes
return_level query The incident data structure returned: return level ("partial", "normal", "full").
                                                                          partial: partialIncidentDTO
                                                                          normal: incidentDTO
                                                                          full: fullIncidentDataDTO
    no
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json QueryDTO (JSON) Filters and sort criteria to use for the query.
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json PartialIncidentDTO (JSON) The list of incidents that match the supplied query filters, sorted by the order specified in the query.

Request Parameters

x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

     no
org_id path The organization ID.   int no
field_handle query -1   yes
return_level query     no
Request Body
media type data type
application/json QueryPagedDTO (JSON)
Response Codes
code condition

400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid

500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible

media type data type

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
inc_id path The incident ID. int
org_id path The organization ID. int
vers query The latest version that the client already has. If the server hasn't changed since int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json FullIncidentDataDTO (JSON) Returns the requested incident. that version then an HTTP 304 Not Modified will be returned.

POST /orgs/{org_id}/incidents/{inc_id}/tasks

Adds a custom task to the incident.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
inc_id path The ID of the incident to which the task is to be added. int
org_id path The organization ID. int
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json TaskDTO (JSON) The task data.
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json IdentifierDTO (JSON) An object containing the identifier of the newly added task object (see the "id" field of the returned object).

GET /orgs/{org_id}/incidents/{inc_id}/due_soon

Gets a list of tasks that are due soon (within the next 7 days).

GET /orgs/{org_id}/incidents/{inc_id}/related

This method has been deprecated.

*

This endpoint is deprecated in v26 and will be removed in v27. Applications using this endpoint should switch to using the GET /rest/orgs/:orgId/incidents/:incId/related_ex endpoint. The deprecated behavior of this endpoint will truncate the results based on a server configurable limit, and there is no indication that the results are being truncated. That information is available in the related_ex endpoint.

Gets the list of related incidents for the given incident.

inc_id path The incident ID.   int
org_id path The organization ID.   int
artifacts query true if the return should include the artifact_history. Default is false if not specified. false boolean
attachments query true if the return should include the attachment_history. Default is false if not specified. false boolean
data_type query true if the return should include the data_type_history. Default is false if not specified. false boolean
incident_details query true if the return should the incident_details_history data. Default is true if not specified. true boolean
milestones query true if the return should include the milestone_history. Default is false if not specified. false boolean
record_count query true if the return should include the record_count_history. Default is false if not specified. false boolean
tasks query true if the return should include the task_history data. Default is false if not specified. false boolean
